# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    @assert typeof(df[1, :dt]) <: DateTime
    df[:ym] = map(x -> string(Int(Year(x)) * 100 + Int(Month(x))), df.dt)
    return df
end
```

This function assumes that `df` is a DataFrame with at least one row and the first column named `dt` contains instances of `DateTime`. It then creates a new column named `ym` by extracting the year (`Year(x)`) and month (`Month(x)`) from each date-time value in the `dt` column, converting them to integers, and concatenating them together as an integer string in the format "yyyymm".

The result is a new DataFrame with an additional column `ym` that contains the year-month representations of the dates in the original `dt` column.
